intro: Beyeria leschenaultii var. backhousei, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, leathery leaves and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and seasonal blooms.
